instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook pro 13, 820 2879 b, Turn on only with batery
threads.message:
Hey guys, 
At first i have a problem with ppv3v42_g3h, because some liquid damage close to u5010. i clean up and 3v42 came back.. 
After i have a prob with =ppbus_g3h, only have 1.4v. 
I take the fuse F7040, and have 1.4v in the same sides(pin1 and pin2).
i already change u7000 and capacitor c7040..
the board works fine only with battery.  

any ideas ?? 

cumps

threads.title: Macbook pro 13, 820 2879 b, Turn on only with batery
threads.message: Sense resistors R7021/22/51/52 or the traces connecting them to ISL and R7020/50.

threads.title: Macbook pro 13, 820 2879 b, Turn on only with batery
threads.message:
Sense resistors is fine, R7021/22 = 10ohm, 51/52 = 3 and 0.7 ohm.. Traces is ok too.. =( 

sometimes i get 12.6v unstable and then drop to 1.6v.. only turn on with battery and dont charg the battery...

threads.title: Macbook pro 13, 820 2879 b, Turn on only with batery
threads.message: Must be corroded trace in sense circuit. When PPBUS drops to 1.6V does 3V42 bus stay high?

threads.title: Macbook pro 13, 820 2879 b, Turn on only with batery
threads.message: ya, i have stable 3v42.. the traces around U7000 appear to be well. if i let the charge on board PPBUS stay on 12V6, unstable but ok..

threads.title: Macbook pro 13, 820 2879 b, Turn on only with batery
threads.message: What is unstable? With a battery connected it should be stable.
